question.text: It’s dry but very windy. On the motorway, you see a car towing a large caravan in the middle lane. You then move onto a long open stretch of single carriageway, where you pass a motorcyclist. Later, you are travelling behind a long vehicle and want to overtake. Once in town, there are trams directed by traffic light signals and you have to drive across their tracks. Further on, a bus is signalling its intention to pull out from a bus stop.
question.part: What should you do when following the long vehicle?

answer.text: Get closer so that you can overtake more quickly
Drop back so you can see more of the road ahead
Slow down until the long vehicle moves out of sight
Keep pressing the horn to get the driver’s attention
